In Roman architecture, an insula was a kind of apartment building that housed 
most of the urban citizen population of ancient Rome, including ordinary people 
of lower- or middle-class status (the plebs) and all but the wealthiest from the 
upper-middle class (the equites). The term was also used to mean a city block. ...
